se.cbb.jprime.mcmc

Interface ProposerSelector

  • All Superinterfaces:
    InfoProvider
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MultiProposerSelector

    public interface ProposerSelector
extends InfoProvider
    Interface for selecting one or more MCMC proposers for actual perturbation based on their current weights. Implementing classes may e.g. consider:
    • Selecting one sole proposer uniformly.
    • Selecting multiple proposers uniformly.
    • Selecting the next proposer in a round-robin manner.
    • Selecting the next proposer conditioned on the previous ones.
    • ...

    See also MultiProposerSelector.

    Author:
    Joel Sj√∂strand.

      java.util.Set<Proposer> getDisjointProposers()
      Selects a subset of a list of proposers which can then be used for actual perturbations.

      • Methods inherited from interface se.cbb.jprime.mcmc.InfoProvider

        getPostInfo, getPreInfo

    • Method Detail

      • getDisjointProposers

        java.util.Set<Proposer> getDisjointProposers()
        Selects a subset of a list of proposers which can then be used for actual perturbations. It is up to implementing classes to decide whether they e.g. return only a single object or multiple objects. Furthermore, the returned proposers must be guaranteed to be acting on disjoint sets of state parameters.
        Returns:
        a subset of proposers, no pairs acting on the same state parameter.
